meanings.definition: A stone or brick that supports the end of an arch.
meanings.sent1: The ancient bridge had strong skewbacks holding up the arch.
meanings.sent2: The mason carefully placed the skewbacks to ensure the stability of the arch.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the skewbacks of the old bridge.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the skewbacks that held up her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The skewbacks, like loyal soldiers, bore the weight of history.

meanings.definition: A type of joint in masonry construction.
meanings.sent1: The skilled mason used skewbacks to create a sturdy joint.
meanings.sent2: The new building's strength came from the well-made skewbacks in its structure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the skewbacks were secret buttons to a hidden door.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was the skewbacks that connected their lives.
meanings.sent5: The skewbacks locked the stones together like a puzzle.

meanings.definition: The inclined surfaces on which the ends of an arch rest.
meanings.sent1: The architect designed the perfect skewbacks for the graceful arch.
meanings.sent2: The weight of the arch was evenly distributed on the skewbacks.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat loved to nap on the warm skewbacks of the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the skewbacks that lifted the spirits of everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight danced on the smooth surface of the skewbacks.
